name: J Campbells
text: WOW is the best way to describe our experience at this dealership. We were traveling in our 94 Chevy G30 camper van & started hearing the warning squeal from our front brakes. Upon entering the dealership, we were greeted by the owner himself who is so friendly & personable & we thoroughly enjoyed talking to him while the service staff inspected our brakes. Jamie, the service mgr, was so helpful & knowledgeable & ordered our brake pads & we returned the next morning when the service staff replaced the pads & we were out the door in no time. The charge for the work was very, very reasonable which was icing on the cake. We highly recommend this small town business that treats customers like family.

name: Kimberly Austin
text: The Best place to purchase a new vehicle for your bucks! Love them there

name: Pat Pleimann
text:
Not impressed!  I went in to look at trucks and was given the bums rush!!  Mark didn't seem to have time to be bothered.  I told him how much I wanted to spend and he said he only had one truck that would be ready the next morning at 9 am and it was above my price range.  I was dismissed and told to come back in the morning.  Just wondering how a dealership operates with only one truck to sell??
Not the Southern hospitality I expected.

name: Jamie Ball
text: Told a couple of people about my bad experience at a couple of other shops and a different dealership and they recommended Odem and boy they were right. Great service, knowledgeable staff with a passion for cars. They did an outstanding job on my truck and I couldn't been happier.  Great hometown dealership!!!

name: Queen Antoinette
text: Mr Mark Odom is very straight forward and honest. He took his time with me and explained everything to me that I needed to know to help me make a wise decision.  Thanks Mr Odom.

text: If they are as inconsiderate in business as they are in their driving habits I would pass by and not stop.

name: BAMA AUTO SERVICE
text: I’ve personally been doing business with Mr. Pierce and his family for a couple years and can honestly say they are some of if not the most honest and dependable people I’ve ever done business with in my life!! The Pierce’s have gone above and beyond to make sure our business deals have not only been fair but done in way that insures the customers satisfaction above their own!!! I’ve also had the privilege of seeing what they do with their time and money personally in giving back to the community and volunteering in ministry and other activities!! I encourage everyone to do business with them and I’ll go as far as to personally guarantee you’ll be treated fair and honest!!  I own a mechanic shop and have owned multiple businesses in my lifetime. I deal with several car lots and the Pierce’s are the finest people I’ve ever done business with!!!!!

name: Kristin Ayers
text: Love this place I just recently got my 3rd vehicle from them they are an amazing family. And will work with you as best as they can. I will never go anywhere else for my vehicle needs and it doesn't stop there they have boats fourwheelers tractors if you need anything just give them a call and they will help you out as much as possible.

name: Joe Goodman
text: Good quality vehicles and great prices.

name: Caleb Dickey
text: My wife and I both are very pleased with the service we received from Pierce Car and Truck Sales! Highly recommend them if you are searching for a vehicle! Already eyeing my next purchase to be a boat!

name: Doug Williams
text: I bought a Truck and a boat from pierce auto and have been very pleased with the honesty and service with this company and will buy again in the near future 💚 and the prices were fair too I highly recommend them to all my friends.

name: Montgomery Waylon
text: Brought a 2000 Camero from here on March the 1st which was a Friday. I brought the car back in on Monday the 4th and told them the service engine light came on and something under the car was rattling. I was told by the owners son that he didnt know anything about standard shift cars and they would not be responsible for anything wrong with it. Almost 3 weeks later the car starts running hot. When my husband got to me to check it out he opened up the radiator to find that it is full of J.B block seal he runs over 80 gallons of water through the radiator trying to clean it out to no avail. We replaced the thermostat that was so coroded with block seal it was rusted up. I called and left a message with Pierce auto sales telling them that the car was running hot and because someone was trying to cover up a cracked block or blown head gasket and there was so much block seal in the radiator and engine that I didn't know if the car was going to make it home and that I really needed someone to call me back because I had no way to get it home. I never recieved a call back.It cost me $60 to rent a car dolly to drag it home. Now the car came with an outside warranty but because "whoever" filled the motor up with block seal to hide a major problem until they could find an idiot "me" to take the car off of there hands the warranty will not cover the car. So now I have a blown up car sitting in my yard that I drove less then a month and repo men knocking on my door because they want there car back and still after all this time I have yet to recieve a call from anyone at Pierce Auto Sales.  I recieved more help and sympathy from the repo man in 10 minutes then I have from Pierce in 2 months. I paid $1500 down for a car that didn't even last until the first payment was due. I dont bash people or businesses but i have tried every other way to get them to talk to me. I just want my money back so I can get a car that runs and won't leave me on the side of the road less then a month after purchase.

name: Angie Lowery
text: I highly recommend Pierce Auto if you are looking to purchase an  automobile or boat.

name: Carter Rhodes
text: Great folks to do business with

text: Dishonest business practices; avoid this place.

name: Forrest Corzealious
text: I had a pleasant experience. The staff was very courteous and professional! I purchased my vehicle from Brooks Motor. All of my visits has been encouraging. First 2 oil changes were free. The assistance were great in helping me get an Auto Pass card. I look forward to service rendered. BUY IT AT BROOKS!!

resp.text: Thanks for the feedback, Forrest. We strive to provide excellent service to our customers at Brooks Motors and look forward to again provide excellent service the next time you visit us!

name: billodmbellsouth
text: I was greeted immediately when I drove up and got out to look at trucks. Friendly, informative, NICE sales person. Pleasant experience from A to Z! Everything was done the way I think it should be done as far as the whole vehicle purchase experience. If I had to purchase another vehicle (I've been a Chevy man for 50 years!) I would definitely look here first.

name: Kathy Mccutcheon
text: Just bought a new Buick Encore, absolutely love it! My experience buying this car was wonderful and very stress free! Ron Scogin was my sales rep and he was very professional and friendly! His instructions on operating the car before I left the car lot were extremely helpful! Everyone at this dealership was friendly and helpful! First time in many years that buying a car was so easy and stress free! Nice to know I didn't have to spend an entire day going through this process! Love my car and service!!😊

name: Ursurla Barnes
text: I love the fact you can go look around on the lot and not be chased down by a salesperson. When you are ready to test drive you will make an instant friend with the salesperson...very friendly and in-depth knowledge of the cars. I did not leave the Brooks lot with my new car without knowing how everything worked ! Last, but the main reason I purchased again from Brooks was the service department. I am going to describe it as I told them..WOW !! Yes, it is that good.  😊

name: Damesia Crocker
text: Everyone here at Brooks was an absolute delight to work with. They made our purchase  very easy and helped us get into exactly what we were looking for. Thanks to all the staff there for being such a great team to do business with.

resp.text: Damesia, congratulations on your new vehicle purchase, and thank you for your recommendation of our team! We sincerely thank you for your business and hope to continue serving you for many years to come.

name: Big EL
text: Great staff & service!! Friendly & knowledgeable. Beautiful facilities. Service shop is top notch. Tons of vehicles on the lot!!!

name: Chris Owes
text: Joseph Deshler, Preston Brooks, Paula Mashburn and Shawn Minter have all been exceptional throughout the purchase process of my first vehicle as well as during my first service inspection. I would recommend them all to anyone. They listened to me and made sure I got what best fit me although I did not initially know what I wanted. Shawn Minter carried out my first maintenance inspection and explained everything to me in detail although there were no issues I felt comfortable after his thorough explanation.

name: Wanda Etheridge
text: Always willing to help you out.Even made fresh coffee for me after finding out just worked off nights. Great service Rep. Shawn Minter

resp.text: Thank you Wanda for your kind words & Thank you for choosing Brooks! We understand those long hours........

name: Christopher Owes
text: The service at Brooks Motors is fantastic!! Everyone is very professional and helpful. I enjoy each visit to the dealership.

name: Richard Grant
text: Had issue with a 2012 Acadia  we purchased there since day one. many trips in for repair  still present after 5 years. Service rework is frustrating and time consuming. Ownership does not seem to care about customers, I/13/17 service on my 2013 Sierra HD diesel ended any relationship with this dealership. Have owned GM products for 45 years and this is by far the worst dealership  i have worked with. They have some good people but leadership is wanting.

resp.text: Hi Richard, we appreciate you taking the time to respond. The staff at Brooks Motors take our reviews very seriously. Please call Preston Brooks (Business Manager), (334) 636-5485 for ways we can work towards resolving these issues. We look forward to hearing from you soon.

name: Nancy R
text:
I had an oil change done on my Volkswagen.  the staff was very friendly from the time I came through the door.  I really liked that when I pulled up to the Service lane they opened the door and I was able to drive in, then the waiting room was just inside the door.
I will be back for my next service.

name: Scott Myers
text: Great service from Keith and Brooks Service Department that day! Got me in and out quickly!

name: Robin Ogden
text: I had a great experience at Brooks Motor service department they were kind and very friendly also everything was done in a timely manner

name: Richard Brewton
text:
I looked for over a month for the SIERRA I wanted. I had received several emails from Brooks but because of the distance from home I avoided making the drive.  After a frustrating Saturday talking to other dealers, I told my wife Rae I was driving to Thomasville Monday to see what they had.  Rae suggested we make the drive that afternoon.

I never expected to be driving a new SIERRA home that afternoon.

We arrived at Brooks late on Saturday afternoon.  I walked on the lot and found the Sierra I had wanted all along.  Neil was very helpful with the test drive and answering our question.

I had done a lot of research on USAA's car buying site and TrueCar's site as will.  When Neil presented Brooks pricing, it was well within the range  I expected to pay.  The financing was in line with the research I had done as well.

Neil, Kelly and Preston were very gracious staying after hours to complete our transaction.

Rae and I agreed this was the best experience either of us had ever experienced when purchasing a new vehicle. Relaxed, no anxiety and we left totally satisfied with every aspect of the transaction.

Thank you to all!!

PS: THE COOKIES WERE FABULOUS !!!!

resp.text: We're happy to hear that you found our staff so helpful, Richard! We sincerely appreciate your business and kind review. We hope to see you again in the future! Safe travels!

name: William Odom
text: I would like to invite anyone and everyone that is wanting to buy a new or used vehicle you should go to Brooks Chevrolet and Thomasville Alabama I promise you that you won't have that feeling of being harassed or pressured ... These guys are awesome !!

resp.text: We appreciate you too!

name: Erin Andrews
text:
Came to the dealership explaining my vehicle is randomly stalling out. Which is extremely dangerous. If I stalled out in a busy intersection, red light, or train tracks, I could die. And this is the car I carry my 2 babies in. I've worked in the service department industry for years and years before I had my kids and from my knowledge it's a liability to turn away a customer if their car is doing anything that could put you in danger. Well, this dealership did.

That's okay though. I'll call a lawyer if anything happens to me or my family. I'm headed to Chris Myers GMC.

name: Roland Hutchinson
text: Great help in choosing my truck and explaining it's operation and setting up the options.

Thanks.

text: Very Good Experience.

name: Bill Gunnels
text: satisfied

name: Joshua Andrews
text: love it

name: Brandy Peterson
text: These people were totally awesome.and they a family business. Could not have ask for better people to do business with. And if you need a car this is the place to go... Make sure you ask for Blake. He is there son and such a fine young gentleman. He even followed us to our car and open the doors. Very down to earth and respectful people!! I will definitely do more business with them and everyone else should also. I promise u will not be disappointed!

name: Jimmy Johnson
text: Awesome place, very friendly car salesman who aren't pushy, great deals on car. Owner is really willing to work with you and make sure the deal goes through. I got my car at a great price and it was a great car. Joel even helped me when I had issues. Will definitely shop there again.

name: Anthony Parker
text: These are the best people you'll ever meet. Very helpful and full of knowledge about the vehicle. But the thing I like most is the dedication to honesty. Don't find that much nowadays. Awesome crew. Especially LUKE PARKER.

name: Luke Parker
text: Good people. Haven't bought anything from here but I know people who have and my friend works there. I do know they offer warranties which is a plus to me, especially when buying a used car. I would recommend them if your looking for a used car.

name: DodgeCummings 04
text: I have done business with Joel Nuss, who is now the full owner of this dealership. It has been an excellent experience. I, being in the same business as he, know without a doubt he is striving to sell great vehicles and do a good business with people. He wants to make his customers happy. We have had behind the scene conversations about this. You can have full confidence in knowing this place will live up to their end of the deal. They tell what they know about the vehicles. They cannot predict the future of how a vehicle performs, but they try to sell good ones and make people happy.

name: Toni Smith
text: Couldn't be happier with our purchase. Always friendly staff and very helpful. Joel goes above and beyond to make sure he has 100% customer satisfaction. I would suggest buying from them for your next purchase!!

name: James Wright
text: I've had great experiences with these guys. They will always get my business.Salesman Blake Barrett helped me find the perfect truck for hauling and Hunting.I was about to leave the lot with my new truck and the owner Joel Nuss ran out to thank me and he filled my tank up and bought my family dinner for that night.Such a nice family atmosphere here.I will return and I will send my friends to these guys.Also,THANK YOU FOR SPONSORSHIP FOR THE GOOD HOPE HIGH SCHOOL FISHING TEAM.!!!

name: Coins, Dreams & Crazy Things
text: What an amazing team! As a female shopper I know we can sometimes feel intimidated, or even a bit uncomfortable while car shopping. This was not my experience at all at NAW. These gentlemen were informative, honest and most of all respectful. They worked with me for several days with several vehicles until I found the perfect one for my family and I. They are quick to respond to messages, and have truly gone above and beyond what a car dealership normally would. You can trust these guys to get a great vehicle at a fair price, and most of all customer service that doesn't even compare to others in this industry. Trust Joel, Diane, Luke, Blake , Junior and Tommy! It's amazing how I've been treated by these folks!

name: Jason Clark
text: I drove 4 hours there to go purchase a truck. I asked if anything was wrong with the truck and they assured me there was not a thing wrong with the truck and there’s no dents/scratches in truck. When I get there I see there are scratches and dents. The truck had various amounts of minor problems and head aches. The only reason I bought it was because I had already drove 4 hours. I would not consider this a trust worthy business. “Excellent vehicle all the way around” was the biggest lie I’ve heard..  Enjoying the truck so far because the variety of issues.

name: Cody45551
text: I have been dealing with these guys at North Alabama Wholesale autos for over 10 years now. I have to say they will do things that most car dealers wont. I have never had an issue with buying a vehicle from them. Just good people with big hearts!!! Thanks for all u have done!!

name: Christian Simmons
text: Thank you Guys for the great deal on my ram 3500.I called these guys last week and was coming from Atlanta to buy this truck.I sent in a deposit to hold it and when I finally got there the truck was Detailed full of fuel.Joel Nuss also took care of my motel room and dinner here because it was late and I had worked all day before coming up.Joel and Diane Nuss do a great job here and make you feel at home. Has to be the best experience I’ve ever had buying a truck.You guys go above and beyond.There son Blake took care of me as well.Thanks again guys and I will be sending ALL of my friends your way!

name: Terry Reeves
text: Just bought a 2004 GMC Sierra at a great price! The staff was very friendly and family oriented. I would definitely buy from them again I highly recommend North Alabama Wholesale.

name: Stacy Clark
text:
Offered to buy truck and send nonrefundable deposit and got the runaround.

I've bought multiple vehicles from out of state and a $500 deposit tends to get cooperation  from more reputable dealers.

I then offered to have my bank wire the funds or overnight the check and they wouldn't go for that; keep in mind this was Dec 23rd so getting my credit union to fund same day without wiring instructions for an out of state transaction would not be possible.

Was offered the truck if I could get there, 4 hours away, with full cash payment.

Later that day they raised the price 10%, sounds like the owner messed up on his pricing and wanted to find any way to not honor the price he initially offered me.

After reading these other reviews I think it was for the better.

name: Julie Gay
text:
I recently purchased a Tahoe from North Alabama Wholesale. The salesman was very helpful and nice with the process. I would recommend my friends/family members to purchase a vehicle from them. Joel Nuss and his staff tries to make sure each customer leaves happy with their purchase..
⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

name: J&M Custom Crafts
text: They had a great selection of vehicles and I found the perfect truck! Excellent service, and no complaints at all! I would definitely go there again!

name: Mike Ashbaugh
text: Joel! Thanks for my deal! I really enjoy my new Mini Cooper! I got a good deal and it was seamlessly easy to do business with you! That's why I am a return customer!

name: DANIEL LIGHT
text: Purchased 3 different vehicles from them and all 3 had problems but I just fixed the problems..well I thought they would return the favor by helping me out by trying to get out of a truck payment that I purchased from another dealer (the truck was in excellent condition with very low miles BTW)I went in and the old man was sitting looking on his phone basically ignoring me while I was telling him my situation and he didn't even bother to come out and look at it,he just said if it wasn't 4x4 he wasn't interested.. What a jerk!!..and they really do sell junk 9 times out of 10

name: Tyler Letson
text: Bought Durango as is no warranty and tore up down the road but give us loaner car until ours was fixed and later give us a different vehicle that they did not have to do. Anywhere else would not help as much as they did! Very nice and understanding staff.

name: Daniel Perry
text: Wanna say thanks to everyone at North Alabama Wholesale for helping me in every way possible I've bought 2 trucks in the last 4 months and they went above and beyond to work with me. Super nice people recommend anyone who is looking for a vehicle these are the folks you need to see!!

name: Luke Costello
text: I bought a truck from this dealership and got totally scammed. I bought it from another state and trusted the dealership to be honest and trustworthy and did not receive that. I specifically asked the salesman if there was any rust underneath because i know this years truck is prone to that and he told me no and that it was all clean. I had it shipped to me and when it got here it was COVERED with rust underneath and was even missing parts of the body due to being eaten up by rust. I did not even get the truck of the transport truck and told them to ship it back. I had to eat the shipping costs for going there and back. I have now contacted the dealership and told them I want my money returned. This dealership was a total lie and deceitful transaction.

name: Patty Douthit
text: Loving my Nissan Altima that I purchased from these guys. The family environment was top notch. Will definitely send my friends to buy there vehicles there. The owner Joel Nuss had my car filled up and threw in a warranty on the house!!  Customer service was fantastic

name: Reagan Short
text: One of the workers there, Luke Parker, was extremely helpful to me! I highly recommend that anybody use North Alabama Wholesale. You will be very pleased!

name: Clay Messer
text: I only had about a five minute conversation with the sales guy/owner/worker.  I asked him to send me a few more pictures of the vehicle and he acted like it was too much trouble.  I live about 3 hours away from this dealership and just wanted to see a few more pictures before I drove three hours just to look under the hood of a truck.  I can certainly understand that he gets a lot of "tire kickers" in his business, but I run a small business as well.  I treat every customer with the same amount of respect whether they are purchasing from me or not.  If everything checked out okay, I would have given him cash for the full amount just as soon as I could get up there.  Now, I feel that he doesn't deserve any business whatsoever.  That's just my opinion.

name: Jim Nix
text: Joel and his Staff were the Friendliest and Curtious. Joel helped me get the right truck in my budget. Highly recommend these Fine people to anyone. Will do business again. Thanks

name: Brenda Shermon
text: I've bought more than one vehicle from them. My daughter and I both bought our vehicles from Joel. He was nice and informative every step of the way. Their pricing compared to other dealerships is incomparable.

name: Emily Vincent
text: This is a great place to do business, the atmosphere is great, they are a great family to do business with! Their financing is top of the notch, they have a great selection of vehicles, and I highly recommend them if you are looking for a vehicle!

name: Steve Patrick
text: Great selection, friendly and honest sales people. The staff was very professional and helpful! Highly recommend.

name: Amy Cleghorn
text: These guys are awesome.   They have great salesman and very good vehicles and service.   We are working on our 10th one.   Come on down and check them out.   Ask for Blake.

name: Devon Green

After 2 weeks we had a buyer for ours and was told to call the following week and set up time to do the deal on the vehicle I wanted so bad. Steer clear of this car lot! They sold us a car that they knew was for our 16 yr old daughter. We made it home and the next day the car would not shift into gear and then completely died. The owner did take our call and told us it was because a ground wire caused the transmission to stop working. We got the car to a local mechanic we use for everything who tested the car and said there are major electrical issues and multiple transmission codes. They knew this car was a lemon when the sold it to us. I get that used cars are a gamble but not the kind of issues this vehicle has. It's not even worth fixing. TRUST Me there is a reason their cars are priced so cheap. I'm sure not every car the sell is bad but they do sale junk cars/lemons.

BEWARE, Save your money.  You get what you pay for.

text: Good experience will go back for another car. Very helpful on getting me into the right vehicle with the down payment I had. People are super nice. Will recommend to all family and friends.

name: Evan Lewis
text:
Recently bought a car from them. Car seems like it’s a great vehicle and for a reasonable price.

The only problem I had is that we made a deal with them to replace the battery in the car (which was a hybrid) and they gave us a battery that wasn’t for a hybrid. I went back and what should have been a calm discussion about getting the right battery turned into a very heated exchange when the dealer began to call my mother rude and claiming the battery was fine.

The battery ( the 12 V startup one) is a specialty type of battery for a hybrid that only the dealer provides and costs about 500$:

We ended up getting a check from them to get the battery from the dealer (they wouldn’t pay the install price, just the wholesale). The thing is, is that this review would have been 5 stars if they had just been polite and understating when we came to them about the problem. We could have gotten to the same point without the very unpleasant arguing and lying. That had us coming away with what seems to be a great car but a really bad taste in our mouth about the dealer.

Hope the car runs for a long time, but when buying a car from here .... MAKE SURE you get any agreement in writing (be very specific) and check with an inspection place they have done the work correctly  before sigining the dotted line.

name: Mary Lavicka
text: Not the type to generally leave a review, but Im doing so in this case since we felt very strongly about  the people we dealt with. Great, genuine people here. Drove an hour and a half to the location, test drove the 2014 Nissan and took it to get checked out at a near by garage. It checked out- As any used car it had minor things that needed to be addressed but that's to be expected with any used car. I don't expect a brand new car, besides a mechanic shop HAS to give you a long list otherwise they feel like they have not done their job correctly. Came back, negotiated price (which was already low and I admit to that since I did my research). The gentleman was polite and told me he could knock of $200. Paid it in cash and made it through the paperwork hassle free in less than 15 minutes. On the way out I ran into  the owner who  explained to me the way that they conducted their business. They seemed to do well and sold many cars at that location. He was a very down to earth person. The reason for my detailed explanation is to make it clear to anyone that looks at online reviews to take them for a grain of salt. Mid-conversation with the owner I watched a man come into this dealership and demand new brakes and tires on a vehicle he bought a few weeks back apparently, and otherwise threatened to leave a bad review!! People like that get on my last nerve. These folks are selling good quality cars for a fraction of the price. If someone wants a brand new car they need to help themselves to a brand new car store. We don't see shops like this anymore, everything is being bought out and turned into a franchise sore where you would pay at a lot more for the exact same car. We need to value these people.  Anyways it made me angry seeing someone act in such a way. These people treated us very well. We will be back to see you guys.

name: Mirandal Kendricks
text:
While I don't usually leave reviews for places I visit, I was strongly compelled to inform the people of Alabama about my visit and the "OWNER" of this establishment. If I could leave 0 stars, I would.

My mother purchased a car a few weeks ago and today she decided to go on her lunch break and get her tag. Information that should've been provided during her purchase at the dealership was requested from the clerk at the tag/title office. She placed a call and got the owner on the phone and he was attemping to assist her. While he was able to eventually get her the information she needed the process of how she had to get the information from the owner was where she had an issue. She stated that there was a language barrier which she didn't personally mind BUT as she was on her lunch break and had limited time to talk she requested to speak with someone with better English that could accomodate her and articulate the information she needed in a timely manner. The owner became rude with her during her phonecall even prompting the clerk at the window to comment on his rudeness.

I later accompanied her to his dealership as she needed to make a payment on her vehicle as well. Once arriving conveniently the owner was sitting on the front "porch" of the lot. When she expressed to him her issue with the process that it took to get information from him earlier and why she requested to speak with someone with better English he became rude with her again, and constantly interrupted her.  I happened to accompany her on this visit and made a comment about his direct rudeness. I guess he didn't take our visit too well because we'd interrupted his flirting with his employee but he then proceeded to invite the both of us into his office and present to us a dusty old box containing his many "degrees" which from what I saw were merely laminated certificates as if that gave him the right to conduct business and talk to us the way he did. I made the comment that both myself and my mother carried actual degrees from accredited universities, she even having her Masters which at the end of the day should not matter. Him having the title of "OWNER" and his many "degrees" should never give him the right to believe that he should be able to be rude to customers or anyone else for that matter. It takes way more than walking around and merely calling yourself a business owner. Its a matter of action as well. As an owner you should be able to take criticism and responsibility for your actions. A simple apology would've been good enough but my mother didn't even get that. I myself began to get upset because of the way he chose to speak to my mother. I simply could not allow it. I began to explain her position yet he attempted ot interrupt me like he did her. I wasn't allowing that either. Our conversation ended up being a mix of words in which he eventually summoned one of his employees into the room for reasons I still don't know. She attempted to explain that the owner was alone by himself at 8 AM until she was able to get into the office and the fact that she hadn't been able to hang up her purse because he asked her to take the phone. This made no difference to me or my mother because 1. She called around 1 PM not 8 AM & 2. As a business "OWNER" he should've done a better job with tailoring his business to order to fit the needs of customers. If you had staffing issues then as an "OWNER" it was on him to take on that matter himself. Either way it should not fall on the shoulders of the customer to deal with your rudeness and lack of customer service. My mother always raised me to be honest and to speak my mind so here I am speaking my mind and saying that the "OWNER" of this establishment is trash and should better spend his days gaining proper accreditation on what it means to be a good business owner and how to deliver good customer service as well taking some time to fix up his dealership because all it takes is for the wrong person to have an accident on that janky "staircase" on his lot and his entire business under fire due to lawsuit.

This is the worst car dealership I have ever delt with. I told them if they would buy the parts & I pay for the labor or the other way around that I would do that and they wouldn't. They want me to pay for the parts, labor and my car note. That don't work with me. They are crooked and their cars are lemons. I advise everyone to go to another dealership. They're nice when you're looking and rude after you get it. They look out for who they want to look out for. They did my sister and cousin the same way. STAY AWAY!!!!

name: J Live Overdrive
text:
Run! Run away from this place immediately.  I called to ask about a car. I was told it was there....I called again to check their hours and ask about that car and another.  I was assured they were there.  I said it will take me 45 mins to get there...they said they would be ready for me.  Rick was the guy I spoke to.  I arrive and it's sketchy ....lots of cars with damage and flat tires...Rick greeted me and I said hey I was here to see the Mercedes-Benz C Class
...he says, Oh the black one? We just sold that last night...I said, I called you twice today before I came..he said well we got this gray one...both front tires flat on the ground, he said...they just need some air...I said nah let's look at the Hyundai, Rick says, it's right here...points to a really damaged vechicle...says let me get the key..and runs off...another man in a cart come by and hands me the key and I get in and the overhead visor was down in my view so I pushed it up to the roof...it fell right back down...again I tried...again, it fell down...I put the key in the ignition and turned it....nothing...the battery was dead...I looked at the guy and he said "oh you wanted to crank it"....I said well yeah, how else can we test drive..he said, well we don't crank these cars a lot and some have been sitting for awhile...just needs a jump real quick....I said no, I'm going to take my money and leave...what a sketchy place.  If you buy something here it had better be your last hope for anything cause you will not be happy...they straight lied to me
..caused me to drive 45 mins for trash.  I had cash in my pocket ready to buy.  Glad I trusted my gut and left....they wanted 3k for that lemon....I picked up something waaaay nicer at a real car dealership, paid cash and rolled out happy...Do Not Buy From Them!!!

name: angela harris
text: This place is a joke. My sister went here because she found a car that she wanted.  When we pulled up I had second thoughts because the place was a dump.  There were cars on the lot with flat tires, cars with broken window panes, cars wrapped in plastic, and she asked to use the restroom and the inside of the place was nasty.  She went on and purchased the car and the damn thing put us down less than 10 miles from the place.  She called the sales person and he came with an attitude and of course he claimed it was just out of gas.  Of course they didn't want to refund her money, but a few days later they did and withheld 200 of her down payment.  I would not recommend this place to anyone.

name: Robert Bates
text: Stay away! They are deceptive and cheats. I bought a truck from them at an outrageous price (had no options at the time and needed a truck A.S.A.P. for business) and I have spent over $5,000 fixing it in the 6 months I've owned it. I was told by Lee and the "salesman" that the truck was $11,000, only to charge me $13,000. Of course once I realized what they did and contacted them they play dumb and it is too late. I know if I should have taken more time to review and ask questions but it was the end of the day, past business hours already and I needed to leave with the truck that day. Regardless you should never practice those business ethics in any industry. I have had to change the rotors, brakes, brake drums, brake cylinder, master cylinder, calipers and brackets, hub assembly, CV axles, steering arm, I am in the process of changing the transfer case (over $2,000 on it's own) and it still needs a steering column, gear box, front differential, driveshaft and possibly the rear differential. When it's all said and done I will have put at least 5 times the value of this truck into making it run right and paying it off. I am a self employed remodeler and I have missed countless days of work, lost countless jobs and it's gotten to the point that I am having trouble paying for my daughters daycare and buying her essentials. This whole deal has radically ruined my life. These people knew the situation I was in and absolutely took full advantage. Beware!!!

resp.text: Hi Robert, I am so sorry to hear about the terrible experience you had with A&M Auto Sales. Our management has changed since then. We now have a great team behind us to help with any issues with the vehicles for future or current customers!

text: I recently purchased a 2021 Chevrolet Tahoe Premier from Ridgeway Berry at Cook Chevrolet. Ridgeway and Tyre Anderson went out of their ways to make the process as smooth as possible. The owner, Jimmy Cook, made sure to introduce himself and thank me for my business. I've bought a LOT of cars over the years, and this was by far the best buying experience I've had. I'll definitely buy from them again!

name: The JC Project
text: I bought a Tahoe from Cooks. I was told the vehicle had been through an inspection and was problem free other than a blemish on the rear door. I was told that they would pay for this blemish if I went and took it to a shop to be fixed. After purchasing, I noticed the vehicle rode rough and didn’t recognize it during the test drive. The following day I found out the front struts were bad. I called and notified cooks to which they said that it shouldn’t have made it through inspection like that, go take it to a shop to get a quote and we’ll fix it. The quote was $1,558.50. They then denied fixing it. After arguing back and forth they decided to give $200 towards the repair. Either their mechanics have no clue what they’re doing, or they just don’t care about selling “inspected” vehicles that have problems. Typical dealer with lies and a run around. Save your frustration and buy elsewhere.

name: Grant Howell
text: This morning (4/10/20) I spoke with a guy who I believe is named Ridgeway Berry about coming to look at a 35,000 dollar truck. I told him I was pre approved to buy it so there would be no issues getting the money. I’m from the Mobile area and told him that I had a 2.5 hour drive and wanted to make sure that he would hold it for me until I got there. He told me he would. He called me when I was 45 minutes away and informed me the truck was sold and the only thing he had to offer me was “I’m sorry”. I took off work and had a friend ride with me based on this guy’s word he gave to me. I waisted mine and a friend’s time, gas, and lost out on money from work because of this. In return I received an “I’m sorry.” I am putting this out there so others can avoid this issue if one of the salesmen tells them that they will hold a vehicle. I would hate for someone else to get this treatment. The bottom line is, if someone at a business gives you their word then they should hold up their end. This company did not do this today.

text: Back last October I had my truck stolen in Biloxi Mississippi at cruising the coast on a Thursday morning, Biloxi PD called me the next morning and said they had found my truck and the people that had stole it also wrecked it, anyways on that Saturday I struck a deal with Cooper Chevrolet and on Sunday they met me in prattville al with a 2014 Chevy  z71, well it was clean looked really good and they asked if I wanted to drive it and I was like well with only 70000 miles it couldn’t be hurt well when I leave headed back down 65 to talladega this thing was like all 4 tire had 5 pound weights on them it was terrible but anyways I went home loaded the truck up with tools and my clothes and struck out to Pennsylvania to work. I stopped in fort Payne al and had tire balanced and it helped some but to the point before I get to Pennsylvania the backs of both front seats had fell off and a week later tha Ac quits and low and behold today April 22 I had a buddy follow me to my house and when we pull up he asks do you know your truck runs down the road sideways and I was like no. I then followed him down the road to look and sure enough it’s running sideways so I’m sure you can imagine what my view on Cooper Chevrolet is. UPDATE I talked to scott at cooper Chevrolet today April 22 and he said they done an alignment on it before i bought it  and I told him I was going to have it checked out and if the frame was bent they would be hearing from me are a lawyer and he hung up on me. So scott I hope you read this because if the frame is bent it was like that when I bought it from you and if it is I’m gonna have a 4x8 sign made stating how you screw me and all the problems I have with my truck and it will be parked as close to the Cooper Chevrolet dealership as I can possibly get it for everyone to see. Oh yea I just had the CARFAX pulled and it has been wrecked not once but twice on the left side, the side where the wheel sticks out so be on the lookout for it to be parked near your dealership

It has not even been 7months and the check engine light has popped on for the transmission issues, and the vehicle at times dont start with a perfect battery, starter, also alternator, i was furious, then i recieved a call from the owner and i got to an apoointmenr made for me before dawn to bring in the SUV. i was in a Jeep dealership as soon as possible and had the shop over 100 miles away took good care of me thanks Cook Chevrolet. text: The dealership had the vehicle I posted for one price and then sold it for another price. Then when I looked online I realized that the dealership is known for doing such. I think it is very unfair to post a car for one price to get the customers up there and then once the customer is there the price is 4-5 thousand dollars more than what you expect to pay. That is pretty much false advertisement and then they don’t want to give you the vehicle for the price that they have it listed for. I think that is ridiculous and pretty annoying.

My husband only has one off day every now and then and he spent his entire day at premiere and came home with absolutely no answers. We’re very disappointed  in the service department. What’s the point of appointments if it’s still going to take > 6 hours to even get an opinion.

name: VaQuita M. Curry
text: The dealership did not have the color suv that I wanted, but they did find one for me at another dealer. They went to pick it up as well, which was great.  There are a couple things that were overlooked as one of the tires was out of balance pretty badly and the detail job left swirl marks when they washed it (it's a black vehicle, so you can notice everything on them). I had to take it somewhere else to find and correct the tire issue as the dealership informed me that new tires ride a certain way the first 500-750 miles.  I've purchased a number of brand new vehicles, and never encountered a vehicle shaking/vibrating like that.  After I requested that they check again (leaving it with them), I was informed that the tires had too much air. After the issue still existed, I took it elsewhere and it drove so smoothly once the out of balance tire was fixed.  They stated that they would reimburse me. The people are nice at the dealership, but taking a little more time to ensure things are done and checked correctly would have made the overall experience a lot better.

text: Noticed a vibration in frontend of my 2017. Daniel signed me in and said he would let me know what the problem was. In a short time he told me that the transmission fluid needed to be changed and that it would take about 2 hours. I told him to go ahead. In about 2 hours he came and told me I was ready to go.

name: I Am Nerd
text:
I would not recommend buying from this dealership or getting your vehicle fixed from here. The salesman when I was purchasing, knew the budget I wanted to stick too. He quoted us $50 above our monthly amount. We agreed to it. The next day when seeing the financial department, they tell me my monthly price was $75 more than the salesman's quote. So an extra $125 than I was told. Very deceptive but I wanted that vehicle. So I got it. Then the salesman tells me "Hey, we got it pretty close." No not close at all.

Then was told at 7000 miles I would get a complimentary oil change, rotation and balance by the same salesman. Well guess what? Not so, they said I would have to pay for the balance.

Before my free oil change, I ran over a small screw and my back left tire was loosing some PSI. Called the dealership and they told me I would have to pay $250 + for a new tire and work. They said they couldn't patch it. So I called 2 other professional tire shops and they laughed when I told them what the dealership told me. I got it fixed for $8 and took less than 10 min. And it's like brand new. No issues.

If you want to be treated right and not be deceived and lied too, please,  don't come here. Do yourself a favor and find another Chevy dealership.

resp.text: Hi Jacob, we appreciate you taking the time to give us more details about your experience. We value our customer's feedback as we are always looking for ways to improve. Do you mind giving our GM, Robert Pollard a call when you can? (205)424-4121, thank you.

name: Arthur M
text: I dropped my vehicle off Monday morning. I'm told by Daniel that they would look at it THAT DAY. Although he told a guy in line in front of me that it would be Wednesday before he could get an diagnostic. I call Daniel back later that evening for him to tell me that it would be the next morning (Tuesday) before they could look at it. I call Daniel again at 12pm Tuesday and he said that they looked at it off and a couple times but they really haven't looked at it thoroughly and that it would be later that day. I called around 3pm and he said that he would let me know something before they left that day. No call. I call again on Wednesday @at 12 pm and I'm left on hold for a few minutes and the secretary comes back to take a message. He supposedly was  busy with another customer. I don't get a call. Again, I call back around 430pm and he tells me that the mechanic had to hold my battery cable to start the vehicle. And it would be $650  to change my battery cables. SIX HUNDRED AND FIFTY DOLLARS!!  I show up Thursday morning to pick my vehicle up and it won't start. Mind you, I started the vehicle everyday for two weeks since having the initial problem. Daniel laughs in my face  when I expressed that to him. After I left I tighten the battery cable(30 second process)and the truck starts just fine. I took that as we don't want to fix your vehicle if you expect us to do what we say.  Wish I could give them a zero.

resp.text: Thank you, for your business and thank you for your feedback. Our goal is to make every experience a pleasant and memorable one, but we apologize for your inconvenience while visiting our store. Please call our service manager, Barry Sparkman (205)424-4121.

name: Mark Gwynn
text:
I had previous recalls with my company leased truck before and I had taken it to H????? Chevrolet. Short story - it was extremely frustrating working with H?????: it took several days beyond the promised timeframe and the communications were non-existent. I was very angry with how I was treated - even their service manager's apology was poor.

So with these new recalls, I decided to bring the truck to Premiere Chevrolet. My first contact on the phone was terrific and responsive, the service team was ready to go when I arrived, and  the work was done in less than an hour (the original promise from my first phone call was 1.5 hours). The waiting area was clean, pleasant, and safe. I could tell that Premiere Chevrolet was not just a different level of Chevrolet dealership, but a different level of auto dealership and business all together. Everyone respected the current COVID 19 restrictions and protections, so as an "at risk" person, I really appreciated that as well. Everyone was super and Daniel Slaten was extremely professional. I appreciate Premiere Chevrolet's dedication to customer service - it was very apparent!

resp.text: Good work ethic, and attention to detail which is why you’ll always get top notch customer service from Premiere Chevrolet. We are overjoyed that we were able to provide this to you, Mark. Thank you again for your kind words!

name: Kristie Williams
text:
I have a close friend that recently bought a car from this dealership. From the moment she drove off the lot, she begun experiencing problems with her mini copper. She posted her experience, however, it was deleted from the reviews. Here is what she said

"As a spouse of an armed service veteran, I recently purchase a 2012 Mini Cooper countryman from premiere Chevrolet. The day of the purchase one of the warning lights was on, the dealer ship couldnâ  t figure out why it was on and how to get rid of it, That was my first incident  with the car, but since I drove over an hour away to pick the car up I trusted the dealership in that the car was good and they said that it was just a sensor. Two days later the check engine light came on , still thinking that it was the sensors, I over look at the magnitude of the situation. Exactly 4 weeks after having the car, it started smoking so I had to get it towed to Mini Cooper. Mini informed me that I have an oil leak, my turbo went out, and other things. My grand total for repairs come to 13,000 dollars. I think that it was very unprofessional and dishonest that You sold me a car that needed so much work done to it. I would not recommend buying a used car from this business."

name: Emily G
text:
What an absolutely wonderful experience. We drove in from north of Nashville, about 4 and a half hours. I had the pleasure of working with Grant over the phone, then Michael when we arrived. The vehicle we purchased was EXACTLY as described over the phone by Grant, he even sent me pictures via text. He was upfront, honest, and just so kind. When we arrived, the vehicle we came to see was parked in the front and ready for us to look over and test drive. Michael answered all of our questions and was very helpful. When it was time to complete our sale, Grant already had all of our paperwork done ahead of time, it took about 30 minutesto sign a few things  then walk out the door with our new vehicle.

We had been looking for a month for a replacement vehicle for me after mine was totaled. I spoke with numerous dealerships within a 150 mike radius of Nashville. There were several times that we drove over an hour out of our way to see one, only to arrive to find the vehicle was NOT at all as described, it was beyond infuriating. Premier Chevrolet was 100% up front and honest from the first phone call. We will absolutely do business with them again, and also recommend them to our friends and family should they be looking for a vehicle.

Thank you so very much to Grant and Michael for going above and beyond what I even expected from a car dealership. It was so great to meet you both, and we really appreciate you and your hard work.

resp.text: We strive to be the best for you and your car Emily. Thank you for taking the time to acknowledge us, we hope to meet all your needs in the future!  Again, Congratulations on your purchase!

name: Dannielle Myrick
text: I bought a vehicle from Premiere Chevrolet in January of 2019. Hoping that I would not have to have problems with a vehicle for some time. I went to the dealership because I was told they were representable. They sold me a vehicle that has major electrical problems. So now it is July of 2019 and I have a vehicle that has been sitting up for 2 months and cost more to fix than the car is worth. I have already put about $1,000 worth of repairs into the car. And now it's going to cost me quite a bit more to get it running.

resp.text: Dannielle, Thank you, for your business and thank you for your feedback. Our goal is to make every experience a pleasant and memorable one, but we apologize for the inconvenience you have experienced with your car. We want to acknowledge that you have been in conversation with our upper management to address your complaint.

name: Ashley M Richards
text: Premiere Chevrolet has always been good to me. I am a very loyal customer and I always recommend them to anyone until what happened last Thursday. My wallet was stolen and I had money in it. I talked to the owner to see if I could get reimbursed some of the money back and all he said was be is not responsible and just apologized a couple of times. It's the fact that I didn't receive the money back it's the fact that he didn't offer me anything at all. No type of help discounts nothing. I don't want to receive a car from a company that doesn't help you when you really need it. The owner could have helped me he just didn't want to and my wallet was the only one that was stolen. I'm not saying don't go to them for that specific reason but I am saying loyalty or making sure the customer is satisfied doesn't matter to them as much as you think. It's OK though because soon I will doing business with someone else and giving them my car back. He didn't offer me anything to trade in my car so for two days I walked out with nothing. I will receive my belongings back but I won't forget this.

name: toby jolly
text:
Here is how premier chevrolet works:

I just tried to buy the truck in the picture. It is clearly advertised on their website for $43k. I was going to trade my loaded f150 fx4 which is very nice. They offered $17k for my truck. I keep up with truck values pretty close so I know my truck will retail in the $23k range. Whatever, I was expecting a $19-20k trade offer but $17k was close enough to start dealing. EXCEPT... They had their truck at $53k on the paperwork, $10k over advertised price. I also have been looking at these trail boss chevrolets and I know they sell everywhere for under $45k. So, long story short they were trying to get my truck for $7k.

I was in the car business for a lot of years. There are good dealerships out there that treat their customers fair with no bs. Premier is not one of those dealerships. Do business with them at your own risk.

name: Mark Bria
text:
I had to have my AC Condenser replaced after only 57k miles. Apparently this is a widely known problem with GM vehicles and a $1000+ repair cost to the owner that should be covered under a recall or part warranty because of the shear number of failures. Just look it up it is not hard to find. If it were a safety issue it would already be covered.

I will say that the service writer did everything that he could to get my vehicle back to me the same day and was apologetic of the fact that the local dealership has seen a huge number of these repairs. He even went as far as check to see if my 2016 Yukon may be covered with some discount related to the same failure but it appears that GM thinks that it is OK for a part to fail at 60k miles but not at 61k miles.

Dealers should be doing more to convince corporate GM to protect their potential customer base. Someone paying as much as I have for 2 GM vehicles should not be hit with the repair cost for a well documented part failure that continued to be used even AFTER it was identified. GM needs to do the right thing if they want to have my continued business.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback and thank you for your business. We appreciate your business and we are looking forward to GM to properly address your concerns.

text: Charged $96 for an oil change on a 2014 Silverado, we have 23 fleet vehicles and have never paid that much for an oil change. We have a bunch of vehicles in the area for the Amazon project and will not be taking them here. Average is $65 for most of our trucks that get regular oil changes across the US.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave Premiere Chevrolet a review. We make every attempt to be competitive within the marketplace. Our recommended oil change consists of fully synthetic oil, the required filter and an engine oil treatment. The fully synthetic oil reduces the number of number oil change visits allowing you to drive up to 7,500 miles between oil changes. The oil treatment includes an oil additive that helps clean sludge buildup and deposits, helps prevent oil breakdown, reduces engine wear, increases fuel economy and extends your warranty coverage when serviced at the proper intervals. However, we do offer a non-synthetic conventional oil service for under the national average for $59. We appreciate your business and we will continue to strive to provide you with the best customer service. I would like to talk to you personally to address your concern. Please call Bill Whitehead, partner/owner at 205.424.4121.
